conclusion: To determine the time at which particles A and B are farthest apart, we need to analyze their relative positions based on the given velocity-time (v-t) graph.
The area under each curve in a velocity-time graph represents the displacement of each particle.
Particle A and B start from rest and from the same position.

premise: The area under each curve in a velocity-time graph represents the displacement of each particle.
conclusion: Displacement is calculated by finding the area under the curve for each time interval.
From 0 to \( t_0 \), Particle A has a triangle area under the curve.

premise: From 0 to \( t_0 \), Particle A has a triangle area under the curve.
conclusion: Particle A: Triangle area = \( \frac{1}{2} \times t_0 \times 2v_0 = t_0v_0 \)
From 0 to \( t_0 \), Particle B has a triangle area under the curve.

premise: From 0 to \( t_0 \), Particle B has a triangle area under the curve.
conclusion: Particle B: Triangle area = \( \frac{1}{2} \times t_0 \times v_0 = \frac{1}{2}t_0v_0 \)

premise: Particle A: Triangle area = \( t_0v_0 \), Particle B: Triangle area = \(\frac{1}{2}t_0v_0 \)

conclusion: From \( t_0 \) to \( 2t_0 \), Particle A has a trapezoid area under the curve.

premise: From \( t_0 \) to \( 2t_0 \), Particle A has a trapezoid area under the curve.
conclusion: Particle A: Trapezoid area = \( \frac{1}{2} \times (2t_0 - t_0) \times (2v_0 + v_0) = \frac{3}{2}t_0v_0 \)

premise: Particle A: Triangle area = \( t_0v_0 \), Trapezoid area = \(\frac{3}{2}t_0v_0 \)

conclusion: From \( t_0 \) to \( 2t_0 \), Particle B has a trapezoid area under the curve.
